title: Drawing, Triumphal arch standing in a pool
title_raw: Triumphal arch standing in a pool
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A bridge leads to and passes under the arch. The fron shows below pairs of Doric columns supporting the lower entablature. Statues and relief medallions are shown in the intercolumniations. The arch is flanked by genii and oblong reliefs. A quadriga upon a pedestal is on top. Traces of framing lines at the edges.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Triumphal arch standing in a pool. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1193
